meaningMnemonic:
A regular <kanji>eat</kanji>ing <kanji>occurrence</kanji> is also known as a <vocabulary>meal</vocabulary>. 

食事 can refer to a specific meal, like breakfast, lunch, or dinner. It can also mean your overall <vocabulary>diet</vocabulary>, like the kinds of foods you usually eat. 食事 can even be a verbal noun for the act of <vocabulary>dining</vocabulary>, so 食事する can be used to talk about having a meal.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
